thread.title: Live Blog: India vs Australia, 1st Test, Pune
thread.title_full: Live Blog: India vs Australia, 1st Test, Pune

title: Live Blog: India vs Australia, 1st Test, Pune
text:
— BCCI (@BCCI) February 23, 2017 09:28 AM (IST) India's playing XI 
Murali Vijay, Lokesh Rahul, Cheteshwar Pujara, Virat Kohli(capt), Ajinkya Rahane, Wriddhiman Saha(wk), Ravichandran Ashwin, Ravindra Jadeja, Jayant Yadav, Umesh Yadav, Ishant Sharma 09:27 AM (IST) Australia's playing XI 
Australia: David Warner, Matt Renshaw, Shaun Marsh, Steven Smith(capt), Peter Handscomb, Mitchell Marsh, Matthew Wade(wk), Mitchell Starc, Steve O'Keefe, Nathan Lyon, Josh Hazlewood 4.4 OVERS Australia: 14/0 I Sharma to Renshaw, Gets right behind the line of the delivery and defends it back to Ishant. 4.3 OVERS Australia: 14/0 I Sharma to Renshaw, Angles it away from the batsman, Renshaw opens the face of the bat and defends it towards point. 4.2 OVERS Australia: 14/0 I Sharma to Renshaw, Length ball on middle and leg, flicked through square leg for a comfortable couple. 4.1 OVERS Australia: 12/0 I Sharma to Warner, Fuller and down the leg side, Warner nudges it fine down the leg side. Ashwin at long leg cuts it off as the batsmen get a single. 3.6 OVERS Australia: 11/0 R Ashwin to Renshaw, The batsman has defended it by getting right behind the line of the delivery. 3.5 OVERS Australia: 11/0 R Ashwin to Renshaw, Quicker one outside off, Renshaw allows it to go through to the keeper. 3.4 OVERS Australia: 11/0 R Ashwin to Renshaw, Loopy ball around off, defended off the front foot again. 3.3 OVERS Australia: 11/0 R Ashwin to Renshaw, Comes forward to this full ball and keeps it out. 3.2 OVERS Australia: 11/0 R Ashwin to Renshaw, Turn and bounce! Tosses it up around off, it turns away after pitching, Renshaw prods forward to defend but is beaten by the sharp turn there. The ball goes off Saha's gloves and Rahane at first slip dives to his right to stop that one. 3.1 OVERS Australia: 11/0 R Ashwin to Renshaw, Floated ball around middle and off, defended down into the ground. 2.6 OVERS Australia: 11/0 I Sharma to Warner, This one bounced a bit more. Sharma bangs in a short ball, it kicks off the surface as Warner hops and taps it towards the off side. Another good over from the tall lanky fast bowler. 2.5 OVERS Australia: 11/0 I Sharma to M Renshaw, Fuller and curling in a bit, Matt works it towards wide of mid on and sets off. Pujara gets to the ball and fires in a throw at the bowler's end but misses. A single picked up and this is good running between the wickets. 2.4 OVERS Australia: 10/0 I Sharma to Renshaw, Good length ball, just around off, Renshaw gets behind the line and defends it off the front foot gently. 2.3 OVERS Australia: 10/0 I Sharma to Renshaw, Strays it outside off, Matt has got nothing to do with that one. 2.2 OVERS Australia: 10/0 I Sharma to Renshaw, Length ball around off, Renshaw pushes it with an angled bat towards point. Looks for the single but won't get it. 2.1 OVERS Australia: 10/0 I Sharma to Warner, Good running! Back of a length ball on middle and leg, Warner tucks it towards square leg and scampers through for a single. There is a shy at the bowler's end but misses. 1.6 OVERS Australia: 9/0 R Ashwin to Renshaw, Tossed up around off, Renshaw comes forward trying to shoulder his arms but the ball hits his back elbow and rolls towards the off side. 1.5 OVERS Australia: 9/0 R Ashwin to Renshaw, FOUR! Bad delivery and duly punished! This one skids through the surface but going down leg, Renshaw just clips it on its way past Ishant Sharma at short fine leg for another boundary. 1.4 OVERS Australia: 5/0 R Ashwin to Renshaw, Quicker through the air around off, MR doesn't play at it. 1.3 OVERS Australia: 5/0 R Ashwin to Renshaw, Nicely tossed up around off, Renshaw prods forward to defend but gets an inside edge on the pads as the ball just falls short of the man at silly point. Kohli should bring in a short leg in place as well. 1.2 OVERS Australia: 5/0 R Ashwin to Warner, Floats it up around middle and leg, worked towards mid-wicket for a single. Warner is off the mark. 1.1 OVERS Australia: 4/0 R Ashwin to Warner, Tossed up around middle and off, Warner goes back and defends it towards the leg side. Virat Kohli wasting no time here. Immediately brings on Ravichandran Ashwin to bowl. Spin straightaway! 0.6 OVERS Australia: 4/0 I Sharma to Renshaw, Beaten! Pitches it up and outside off, Renshaw looks to defend it off the front foot but gets beaten all ends up. The ball goes on the bounce to Saha. A good first over from Sharma, he was hitting nice lengths. 0.5 OVERS Australia: 4/0 I Sharma to Renshaw, Good length delivery outside off, Renshaw presses forward and defends it towards point. 0.4 OVERS Australia: 4/0 I Sharma to Renshaw, Back of a length ball outside off, Renshaw opens the face of the bat and defends it in front of gully. 0.3 OVERS Australia: 4/0 I Sharma to Renshaw, Angles this one in from outside off, Matt gets behind the line to defend it down. 0.2 OVERS Australia: 4/0 I Sharma to Renshaw, Length delivery outside off, Matt Renshaw looks to have a tame push at it from inside the line but gets beaten. 0.1 OVERS Australia: 4/0 I Sharma to Renshaw, FOUR! Edged and Australia are away! Sharma hurls in a length ball just around the off stump channel, it stays low and moves away a bit, Renshaw tries to poke at it and ends up getting a thick outside edge past second slip and the gully fielder for a boundary. Though it came off the edge but that should ease some nerves for the batsman. The National Anthems have been done and dusted with. There is an Indian team huddle near the boundary rope. Kohli is sharing something with his boys and now out come the Aussie openers - David Warner and Matt Renshaw amidst loud cheers. Ishant Sharma will start off with the bowling proceedings and he has a couple of slips and a gully in place. Here we go!!! The players are out for their respective national anthems. Virat Kohli says wanted to bat first. Adds they have lost the toss in the past but still have won the games so this would keep them in contention. They would look at this as another challenge. Informs they have opted Jayant Yadav in place of Bhuvneshwar Kumar and have two seamers, Umesh Yadav and Ishant Sharma, who can exploit the reverse swing. Continues saying the preparations have been good and would be hoping that they can continue the same way in the match. Ends by saying in the ODI game against England the crowd came in numbers and with the weekend fast approaching, he is expecting larger numbers in the stands. Steven Smith says they will bat first. Adds the wicket is very dry and it won't bounce much and could spin from ball one. Hopes they can post a good total on the board. When asked he should know the conditions well as he plays here in the Indian T20 League, he adds it looks a bit different from the T20 deck. Further says the preparations have been great and the boys are up for the challenge. Informs they are going with two fast bowlers, two spinners and an all-rounder batsman. TOSS - Virat Kohli spins the coin. Steven Smith calls Heads. It is a Head. AUSTRALIA WILL BAT! Pitch Report - Ravi Shastri says he has never seen a pitch like this in Indian conditions. Adds no water has been poured on it since last 7-8 days. Further says there are huge cracks on it, it might dry and open up. Informs when the ball will land on the footmarks, it will misbehave. Shane Warne also says it's a good wicket and continues saying he has never seen a pitch like this. Feels this looks like a day 5 wicket. The toss will play a crucial part according to him. Unbeaten in the last 19 Tests, that is not taken to be lightly by any means. Australia know this, Steven Smith especially knows this, and we all know the men from Down Under have never backed away from a challenge. Today, we will see how the Aussies fare after all their intense preparations, first in Dubai and then coming to India. Going to be a super contest without a shadow of a doubt. Hello and welcome, ladies and gents.... A lot has been said about the home side winning this battle with considerable ease. The wicket in Pune is expected to be dry and in Steven Smith's own words, he expects it to turn right from Day 1. The Aussie skipper has spoken out against the scrutiny of his team and despite admitting that it is going to no cakewalk by any means, is eager to prove everybody wrong. The last time India lost a Test match at home was back in 2012, when England won in Kolkata. The tides are have turned this time 'round as it'll be the Aussies who feel the heat in Pune. A tough road lies ahead for the visitors. With India unbeaten in their last 19 Test matches, most of which have been played at home, it's been pipped that this is a David-Goliath battle. 09:03 AM (IST) TOSS: Australia win toss, opt to bat first. 08:51 AM (IST) Odds against Australia as they seek Asia turnaround 
Despite this four-match series pitting the top two sides in the ICC Test Championship against each other, there is a distinct air of a mismatch lingering over the 2017 Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Steven Smith's Australian team heads into the four-match series against the ICC's top-ranked Test side as definite outsiders, having not won a Test on the subcontinent since 2011. 08:50 AM (IST) Hello and welcome to our live coverage of the first India vs Australia Test in Pune. From around the web More from The Times of India Recommended By Colombia
